question: Where did the boy and his sister live?
answer1: in an uninhabited country far out in the northwest

question: Why was the boy called the Boy that carries the Ball on his Back?
answer1: He possessed supernatural powers.

question: What happened after the man received the moccasins?
answer1: The man took up his war-club and set out in quest of the distant village.

question: Who invited the man in?
answer1: a very old woman

question: What did the old woman say the man could not succeed without?
answer1: the invisible bones they use in the medicine-dance

question: Where did the two false daughters dwell?
answer1: a great tree which is smooth and without bark

question: What happened to the man's elder brothers?
answer1: have been destroyed
answer2: were killed by the false daughters

question: What did Onwee changed himself into?
answer1: a squirrel

question: Why did Onwee thrust one of the bones into the trunk of the tree?
answer1: He remembered the instructions of the old woman.

question: What did Onwee do after he turned into a squirrel?
answer1: mounted nimbly up again

question: Who were the two wicked sisters?
answer1: Azhabee and Negahabee

question: What did Ownee do when the bones were gone and the lodge was well-nigh out of sight?
answer1: began to despair

question: What did Ownee notice whenever he addressed the sister on his left hand?
answer1: The tree would tremble as before and settle down to its former place

question: Why did Ownee continue to address the sister on the his left hand?
answer1: He wanted to get closer to the ground.
answer2: He wanted the tree to descend.
answer3: He wanted to be settled down near the earth

question: How did Ownee kill the wicked women?
answer1: He raised the club, and with one blow laid the two wicked women dead at his feet.

question: Why did Ownee set off at random?
answer1: learned that these sisters had a brother living with their father who would now pursue him for having put an end to their wicked profits

question: How did the brother feel when the father told him his sisters were slain?
answer1: greatly inflamed

question: Who did the brother blame for his sisters' deaths?
answer1: Ownee

question: What would happen if the brother tasted food before he succeeded?
answer1: The brother's power would be destroyed.

question: Why did the son take all of his father's advice but the portion which enjoined upon him to abstain from staying his stomach?
answer1: The brother of the two wicked sisters had, among numerous noble gifts, a very noble appetite.

question: What did Onwee do when he found that he was closely followed?
answer1: climbed up into one of the tallest trees, and shot forth the magic arrows with which he had provided himself

question: What did Onwee transform himself into?
answer1: the skeleton of a moose that had been killed

question: What did the angry brother find when he followed the track?
answer1: a pair of moccasins

question: Why did the brother not allow himself to enjoy a meal?
answer1: He thought of the blood of his sisters.

question: What did Onwee fill the lodge with?
answer1: every thing that could delight the eye, or was pleasant to the taste

question: Where did the brother stop?
answer1: a beautiful garden

question: Why did the brother partake heartily of the meal?
answer1: He was faint and weary with travel, and he felt that he could endure fasting no longer.
answer2: His appetite was terribly inflamed by the sight of the choice food that was steaming before him.

question: What happened to the brother after eating?
answer1: fell into a profound sleep

question: What did Onwee do when the brother fell asleep?
answer1: fetched the slumbering brother a mighty blow

question: How will the village feel about Onwee killing the brother of the two wicked women?
answer1: happy

question: What did Ko-ko announce?
answer1: He was going to do something extraordinary himself.

question: Why didn't Ko-ko take Onwee's war-club?
answer1: He had not the strength to lift it.

question: What did Ko-ko steal from Onwee?
answer1: the moccasins

question: Why did the man ask his sister to make him several pairs of moccasins?
answer1: He was going to visit another village.
answer2: He wanted to use them for a trick.

question: How did Ownee trick the angry brother?
answer1: He placed the moccasins near the moose's skeleton.
answer2: He ordered the moccasins to the end of the earth.
answer3: He told the moccasins to leave a trail.

question: How will the brother feel when he realizes he has been tricked?
answer1: angry

question: Why did Onwee fill the lodge with food?
answer1: make the brother eat and lose his powers

question: Who did not praise Onwee?
answer1: Ko-ko, the Owl

question: How did Ko-ko initially react to the news that the wicked young women were dead?
answer1: confused

question: How will Ko-ko feel about fighting the father?
answer1: excited

question: Why did the moccasins suddenly leap and leave the Owl flat upon his back?
answer1: The moccasins did not want to take him home.
answer2: The moccasins knew he wasn't its owner.

question: Why did Ko-ko run away into the woods?
answer1: He was a coward.
answer3: He did not want to be recognized.

question: Who mistook Ko-ko for his brother?
answer1: an old chief

question: Who did the old woman say was still living?
answer1: the father

question: What did Ko-ko do when the old woman offered advice?
answer1: laughed to scorn the proposal

question: What happened after Ko-ko called on several guardian spirits to turn him into a squirrel?
answer1: Not one of all them seemed to pay the slightest attention to his request.

question: What did Ko-ko think was the reason for the guardian spirits' lack of attention?
answer1: The guardian spirits were either all deaf, or indifferent to his wishes, or absent on some other business.

question: What happened to the fish-bone after Ko-ko thrusted it into the trunk of the tree?
answer1: snapped

question: Why did Ko-ko's arrows have no effect on the father?
answer1: They were no more than common arrows.

question: Why didn't Ko-ko have the slightest confidence in any one of the guardians?
answer1: The guardians did not help him climb the tree.
answer2: The guardians did not transform him into any animal.

question: What happened after Ko-ko gave orders to the enchanted moccasins?
answer1: They turned immediately about in the way in which the wicked father.

question: Why was the village a place where no one returned?
answer1: The wicked family killed people.
answer2: The wicked family had supernatural powers.

question: Why did Ko-ko reject the old woman's help?
answer1: He wanted to be better and braver than Onwee.
answer2: He believed he could do it by himself.
answer3: He did not believe the old woman's warnings.
